text:
56-year-old gentleman with CLL and large cell transformation, s/p
   antigen mismatched URD SCT on [**2124-3-10**] recently discharged from [**Hospital1 19**] to
   [**Hospital 189**] Rehab on [**8-17**] and re-admitted to the floor on [**8-21**] for
   diarrhea, waxing/[**Doctor Last Name 533**] mental status, and electrolyte abnormalities.
   He is found to have BK viremia and was started on cidofovir on [**8-25**].
   He was transiently in [**Hospital Unit Name 1**] and was called out [**2124-8-28**].  He was again
   in the [**Hospital Unit Name 1**] [**9-5**] to [**9-6**] for hypothermia and agitation of unclear
   etiology. He returned to the floor and suffered from worsening
   agitation and unresponsiveness treated with increasing antipsychotic.
   He also had bilateral SDH with no intervention planed by neurosurg. His
   BK viremia has also worsened since last ICU admission.
   .
   O/N he was found Chenne [**Doctor Last Name 559**] breathing and quickly lost a pulse. Once
   pt was identified as DNR, but intubation and pressors ok compressions
   were stopped. He received 1mg epi with return to afib in the 150 with
   pulse. He was intubated and transferred to the [**Hospital Unit Name 1**].
   Anemia, other
   Assessment:
   Post transfusion hct 20
 22, hematuria and melena x1
   Action:
   Additional 1unit RBCs given.
   Response:
   Post transfustion hct 22
  24. pt had large melena stool at 5am, hct
   sent and pending.
   Plan:
   Transfuse PRN, monitor for signs of bleeding.
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Repeat head CTdone [**9-11**] AM, no change in subdural hematoma and no
   midline shift. pt opens eyes but does  not follow commands or track.
   Moving BUE but not BLE. Occasionally becoming agitated lifting head and
   tonguing ETT.
   Action:
   Remains off cont sedation but occasional fent boluses given for
   comfort.
   Response:
   No changes overnight, does not follow commands or track. .
   Plan:
   Cont to monitor mental status, fent PRN for agitation.
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   Multiple skin issues to the scrotum, buttock and both arms.
   Action:
   Generalized anasarca w/ weeping. Freq reposition, kerlex/softsorb to
   BUE, 2 large open blisters on scrotum, softsorb and elevated.
   Response:
   Cont to be edemadous and to weep, conts w/ icteric/red urine.
   Plan:
   Cont w/ freq repositioning and change kerlex/softsorb PRN.
